title: Calories in 1 Cup of Flour
meta_description: Learn calories in 1 cup of flour, plus full nutrition breakdown including carbs, protein, and fiber on a per-cup basis with easy tweaks for recipes.
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted, spooned into measuring cup (≈120 g); no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type (e.g., whole wheat, bread), brand, sifting/packing method, and moisture. Weigh ingredients for precision; check labels.

quick_answer.text: 1 cup of all-purpose flour provides about 455 kcal, mostly from 95 g of carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use sifted all-purpose flour (less dense, ≈110 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of flour?
faqs.a: Approximately 455 kcal for 1 cup of all-purpose flour.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 1 cup of flour?
faqs.a: About 95 g of carbohydrates, with 3.4 g fiber and minimal sugars.
Yes, 1 cup provides around 12 g of protein.

faqs.q: How does whole wheat flour compare in calories?
faqs.a: Slightly lower at ≈425 kcal per cup, with more fiber (≈12 g).

faqs.q: Is 1 cup of flour the same weight for all types?
faqs.a: No—density varies; all-purpose is ≈120 g, while cake flour is lighter at ≈100 g.
